title: Yellowstone National Park: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping        The dining room of the historic Old Faithful Inn, which opened in 1904. NPS/Jim Peaco   Â    Everyone needs to eat and sleep, and Yellowstone provides lots of options:    9 lodges (over 2,000 rooms) 12 front-country campgrounds (over 1,700 sites) Numerous restaurants ranging from fine dining to snack shops and cafeterias 52 picnic areas  Reservations for lodging and camping can be made through Yellowstone National Park Lodges.   More Information   Check the opening and closing dates of facilities in Yellowstone. Look for lodging, camping, and other services outside the park.  Learn about the other services offered in the park like gas stations, post offices, medical facilities, and more.
